reviews.title: fantastic hotel for a wedding !
reviews.text: we got married at the el senador with fifteen members of our friends and family.
myself and my then boyfriend visisted this hotel in june 2004 where he proposed to me ,we therefore found it very fitting to return there to get married.
reviews.title: Disappointing!

reviews.text: as a travel agent i have been lucky enough to travel very extensivley throughout the world and would definatley recommend cuba as one of my firm favourites!.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: It remains to be said that the hotel however was in the middle of a takeover and so many of the facilities were been upgraded and as the management were getting replaced they didnt care too much about any complaints.
reviews.title: Time Of Our Life!
Far from what We expected
reviews.text: therefore i would have graded the accomodation five instead of four in the previous year .
My bride of 27 years and I just returned for the El Senador for the week of November 12th - 19th, 2005
reviews.title: El Senador absolutely great!!
Wonderful Spot
reviews.text: We where in one of the Lagoon villas and found that the air conditioning worked great for all but a couple of hours when they had larger issues with all the villa's air not working.
The food was very good! If you have the opportunity do try the VIP restaurant. The lobster was outstanding! The Steak house is also excellent!
reviews.title: A week in paradise!
pleasant week
reviews.text: This resort is very Canadianized!

reviews.title: Such A Disappointment...NEVER AGAIN
reviews.text: Side bacon most days for breakfast. Canadian Maple Syrup for your sweet tooth. Food was good in all the restaurants including the buffet's and if it was suppose to be hot it was hot! Fruit that was in season was very good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our flight and transfer whent smoothly Trouble began when we arrived at the hotel. The room was spacious and well designed. The bedding smelled of mold. The bathroom was barely functional. There was no food available other than french fries or cheese pizza. The beer was good. There was a strong smell of sewage in the lagoon area.
reviews.title: Not your best choice

reviews.text: Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment. Not a lot of fresh fruit, the pancakes were cold and tough and the juice was made from a powder mix.
reviews.title: Had fun, but I will not be returning to nh Krystal.

reviews.text: Huge lineups for the reservation of a la carte spots (2 hours), lineup for beach towels was 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Not what we expected...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was amazing. Beach bar lineups were lengthy, lineups everywhere no matter what you were wanting.
reviews.title: Excellent resort

reviews.text: Lunch was more disappointing that breakfast.
reviews.title: Pack your Immodium
The time of my life!!!
reviews.text: Knowing what a great help this site was during the planning stages of my vacation, I had told myself that I would write a review immediately after my return. But like usual, I got preoccupied and never had a chance. So here it is…5 months later.

reviews.title: Should've gone to Tryp
reviews.text: Six friends and I (ages 19 to 21) stayed at el senador in caya coco from may 1st 2005 until may 8th 2005. I have to say that it was the best week of my life (so far!!!). I will try and keep this review short and sweet and give as much useful information as I can.

reviews.title: Didn't want to come home!!
reviews.text: First of all, ignore all those who gave negative reviews. Sure the week was not perfect and some things could have been better, but we were there to relax a forget about our stressful north American lives back home. Cubans are very relaxed people and are often in no hurry to do things; but neither were we! Go there with an open mind…we have a lot to learn from their simple, stress free ways. Enough bla bla…

The beach was wonderful…I have never seen anything more beautiful. Blue, clear water and soft white sand; what more could you want. There were also more then enough lounge chairs for everyone and there was no need to rush to the beach at 8am to reserve your spot.
reviews.title: needs help
Not what we paid for
reviews.text: The bar was, of course, all you can drink 24 hours. Many, many, many, cervesa’s (beer…the only Spanish word I used!!!) were drunk and appreciated (very good and cold beer!!!). There are also many other types of drinks, enough to satisfy everyone’s varied tastes.
Seens good on web and some people seemed to have no problems. When we were there many were complaining, nobody was listening. Generally 1 or 2 Star at best... Poor Poor Poor
reviews.title: Save your Money, Don't Go you will be disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We flew in early our choice, 11am, but rooms were not ready till 4pm the check out was noon. Ok we can live with that. But the front desk kept saying come back and check, although they had no intention of giving us our room till 4pm.Plus no place to lock up luggage. What we found out was if you find out your room number, just had to ask you go and negiotate with maid to call in the room was ready, and then you could get your key card. The week we were there there was only hot water at 3am all other time slightly warm water or cold. Hotel didnt care. We were on the third floor of our villa, at night the lights were always out, hotel did nothing after several complaints. Food was bad each and every day, below par. We did lose weight! - (Good) and it was sunny and warm, good. Not much else that was good
reviews.title: Disapointed, but me made out fun out of it

reviews.text: We are a young couple and we wanted to go somewhere fun and relaxing. We didn't book wih an agent (online) and we had a good impression at first for NH Krystal.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money or time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No problems at all with the agency, I won't talk about them in this
reviews.title: Couldn't wait to get off the resort

reviews.text: review, unless to say that they should rate this hotel as a 3 stars, not 4).
reviews.title: Why the mixed reviews?

likes.disliked: — lack of water pressure in shower

reviews.text: Just got back from the longest week of my life at the El Senador in Cayo Coco. After having been to Varadero earlier this year, I realize that we should have gone back there cause we knew what to expect.
reviews.title: Cuba is beautiful, El Senador not so much

reviews.text: FLIGHT - Flew with skyservice. Tiniest seats ever and no leg room....thank goodness the flight is only 3 hours long.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic holiday!
Worst Place I have ever been too
reviews.text: CHECK IN - Stayed at the Emporador side of the resort. Long lines at check in, was expected since 3 flights arrived at the same time. We got our room and it was disappointing. It smelled of mould, there were dead ants all over the floor, lizards on the window, no shower curtain, and the toilet looked like it hadn't been flushed in 20 years. We went back to reception and got another room on the second floor of another block. The room had no hot water, toilet that flushed when it felt like it and television that was barely visible. Oh and the A/C only had 2 levels OFF and Freezer cold.

reviews.title: Expected more - Got Less - what a shame
reviews.text: WEATHER - First day there was a cold one. We were really frightened to see people with sweaters and jeans on...you're in the carribean!! The first couple days were partly cloudy, evenings were cool -- bring a sweater!! Then for 4 solid days there was intense heat and the weather we had finally been expecting.

reviews.title: Saving money for next year!
reviews.text: BEACH - Stunning turquiose waters...white sandy beach...strip is narrow but very very long, you could walk for miles. There was a lot of seaweed washed ashore, jelleyfish everywhere in all sizes...Varadero was spotless everyday!! Bring bug repellant and spray your room and your bed and yourself. You will notice these tiny red bumps that itch and then multiply, especially at nite.

ok I was at this hotel from January 1st to January 8th and you have to realize that not everyone is the same and that some people complain with every little thing but if your going into your trip thinking there’s going to be something wrong then guess what there is.. Now I went with nine people me my boyfriend my sister her boyfriend and other friend who are also couples. we went with Sunwing and are flight was called on time but then it took 2 hours to put all the bags into the plan and defrost the wings... that alone could have got everyone upset but hey you can't let these things get to you it happens. When we got to the hotel we checked in (it took a while but we waited like every one else) then we got our room which was very clean. Then we were off to eat there was a bit of a line to eat but we waited 5 minutes and we were in. We then went to get our beach towels... There were no towels and we were told that we could only get them tomorrow so we didn't let it get us done and went to the beach anyway... The first 10 minutes my cousin was in the water he got bit by a jellyfish luckily the rest of us didn't I told him to pee on it (which works) but no one believed me so he went to the beach bar and they put vinegar on it which also works but I would advise not to wait and just pee on it its not a big deal. The next day the weather wasn't really on our side and it rained so there goes a day gone of out vacation but that is not the hotels fault nor is the jellyfish they cannot control that. The next day it was cold and windy so again another day gone... Friday comes beautiful SUNNY day no jellyfish I have been to Cuba three times and Dominican Republic once I am telling you this is the nicest beach I have ever been to I have never seen anything like it crystal clear water and it was also warm you will not be disappointed with the beach ...ALL of the hotel is opened some people said half of it was closed no its all opened..BED BUGS I read so may reviews about them I didn't not see one bug in my bed I’m not saying it didn't happen to other people but I wouldn't be to worried about it the only thing I would say is bring some warm clothes incase you have 1 or 2 bad days trust me it can get cold and you don't want to wear the same thing everyday...Food what can I say its Cuba I got a bit sick of it but hey what can you do.. There people at the hotel I read many reviews saying the employees were rude... I not once came across a rude person everyone was so friendly. All I can say is don’t make up your mind about your trip from other reviews go into the trip with an open mind and don’t let small things get to you the chances are if it happened to you it happened to someone else…you just need to learn to let some things go and remember make the most of your trip and have a good time!!!!
reviews.title: Go into your trip into an open mined

likes.disliked: — Food wasn't THAT great but ok

reviews.text: Myself and 2 girlfriends stayed at the N.H. Krystal Laguna from January 4th to 11th 2008.
reviews.title: A nice relaxing vacation!

likes.liked: — The beach, the pools were very nice.
likes.disliked: — The lack of beach/pool chairs, the mosquitos and the lack of toilet paper everywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The flight from Toronto on Air Canada was quick and pleasant. We arrived at the airport on time. Customs were quick and our luggages were waiting for us on the carousel.
reviews.title: Viva Cayo Coco !! Loved it would definitely return!

likes.liked: — The staff, the food, the sun! Trip to Moron to visit locals.

reviews.text: Transfer from the airport to the resort was short on a nice air conditioned bus equipped with toilet.
reviews.title: Great Vacation!
If you have ever been somewhere nice before don't go you WILL be dissapointed
reviews.text: We arrived at the resort approximately 15 minutes after leaving the airport. Very long line up waiting for us at the reception/check-in counter. We waited in line close to an hour to check-in. No welcome cocktails or music while we waited. We were assigned the room we requested when booking our vacation. We were lodged in building 23, room # 2314 on the 2nd floor. There was no valet service and we dragged our own luggage’s to our building. We had to get them up the stairs to the second floor. It was not a problem for us but might be somewhat of an inconvenient for older or disabled people. I imagine one could request assistance if need be.

We just came back on saturday 19 of January from our week vacation from NH Crystal resort. It was amazing! The weather was great, the food was great, the choice of restaurants was great and the the night entertainment was great. We have read some reviews about this resort prior to going and they said that this resort wasn't good. Boy,...were they wrong!!...I don't know if the people that wrote them were just generally negative people or they were just really really picky. Any time that you can get away for a week to a beautiful place for vacation is wonderful and this resort was no exception. It was a great resort! Clean and nice. We had a great vacation.
reviews.title: Great vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned from the NH Krystal Laguna in Cayo Coco, Cuba at the begining of December 2007. We were at this hotel for 3 weeks and trust me it was worth waiting 10 months to go there as this was our only holiday. Got delayed on the flight out from Gatwick but this couldn't be helped i suppose. The holiday was booked with Thomas Cook, but whatever you do, DO NOT BOOK PREMIUM CLASS!! For the extra money we paid we were disgusted. We have travelled Premium Class with Monarch before to Africa so we had an idea of what we should be expecting. We had one hot meal in 10 hours which was served in a cardboard box. The in flight entertainment was also poor. However, the leather seats were comfortable despite having biro marks on the seat backs. We complained seperately to Thomas Cook about this on our return but to date we have had no response.
reviews.title: Delightful Cuba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel on the other hand was excellent, better than we could have hoped. We stayed on an all inclusive basis which was great. Everyone was really friendly from the reception staff to the maids, bar staff and gardeners. Look out for the aqua aerobics lady - she has a good wiggle so my husband tells me!
reviews.title: Don't listen to the negative reviews

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, great room, beautiful resort.
likes.disliked: — Pool areas could be washed down daily.

reviews.text: We were in a superior room in the main buildings of the hotel. These were really spacious and kept spotlessly clean. If i had a complaint it would be that there was no balcony, but the room did have large floor to ceiling windows which could be opened if necessary.
reviews.title: Hard to Believe some people find it so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food choices in the buffett restaurant rotated on a weekly basis so you could guess what was on the menu by the day of the week. However, saying that there was a wide choice.
reviews.title: Awesome Vacation!!

likes.liked: — It was big and had alot of choices in means of pools, food ect. Was never crowded.
likes.disliked: — The long wait time before checkin.
